alpha.meaning: Significance level for conditional independence tests
alpha.reasoning: Use 0.1 for small samples (<500) to avoid missing true relationships. Use 0.05 for moderate samples (500-10000). Use 0.01 for large samples (>10000). Use 0.001 when high precision is required and sample size is very large.

is_discrete.meaning: Whether the data contains discrete variables
is_discrete.reasoning: Set to true for discrete or mixed data to use appropriate statistical tests. Set to false for purely continuous data to use tests optimized for continuous variables.
